body_html:
Hi I am not super familiar with tensor2tensor, but after a quick scan of their code, it seems they support saved model https://github.com/tensorflow/tensor2tensor/blob/master/tensor2tensor/bin/t2t_trainer.py#L171

This can then be converted with tflite_convert https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/lite/python/tflite_convert.py

You should convert to FLOAT before trying quantized because currently you have to train models with Fakequant operations as described here: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/contrib/quantize which can be more complicated to start with.

This can then be converted with tflite_convert https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/lite/python/tflite_convert.py
You should convert to FLOAT before trying quantized because currently you have to train models with Fakequant operations as described here: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/contrib/quantize which can be more complicated to start with.
body:
Hi I am not super familiar with tensor2tensor, but after a quick scan of their code, it seems they support saved model https://github.com/tensorflow/tensor2tensor/blob/master/tensor2tensor/bin/t2t_trainer.py#L171

This can then be converted with tflite_convert https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/lite/python/tflite_convert.py

You should convert to FLOAT before trying quantized because currently you have to train models with Fakequant operations as described here: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/contrib/quantize which can be more complicated to start with.
